name: Wikipedia - Dark, gold, simple
description: by grom. Dark and gold color set for Wikipedia and it's sister sites, designed to be used together with a layout style (as in the posted screenshot). It works on it's own, but doesn't look quite as nice. I recommend you add style 63573. Other layouts suggested below. Enjoy!
additional_info: Suggested layouts (only enable one at the time): → style 63573 (comprehensive layout, screenshot here). → style 62449 (minimal layout, removes stuff). Works on most Wikimedia sites, such as wikipedia.org, wikimedia.org, wiktionary.org, wikiquote.org, wikibooks.org, wikisource.org, wikinews.org, wikiversity.org and mediawiki.org Latest changes: 2014-09-27 - minor fixes. 2014-05-02 - images of text formulas are now inverted to white text on dark background. 2014-01-02 - reverted yesterday's change. 2014-01-01 - tried to fix color pages on Wikipedia, as discussed here - if you see any bright backgrounds that shouldn't be there, please let me know. Happy New Year! 2013-11-13 - styled some popups and menus; fixed coordinates on mouseover; made places on maps black - if you consequently find black text somewhere where it shouldn't be, please let me know. 2013-09-19 - fixed the new "VisualEditor", again. 2013-08-05 - fixed the new "VisualEditor". 2013-07-07 - fixed the new language selection popup. 2013-06-17 - fixed some transparent images, like on https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guitar (thanks user 179728 for reporting) 2013-06-01 - tweaked backgrounds of logos. 2013-05-31 - added wikivoyage.org domain; added background behind logos, per request. 2013-05-14 - added URLs starting with "http://www.baka-tsuki.org/project/".
